CatDescriptText: Rogers Cleveland, hospital worker, Fifth Ward and William Doherty, bellman, Shadyside, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 33 with question: "In your opinion, which political party, Republican or Democratic, has the best record of keeping its campaign pledges to the people of the United States?  Which party do you think would be most successful in carrying out its 1960 campaign platform-this being a Presidential election year?"  Mr. Cleveland's answer reads: "The Democrats have done, and will continue to do, the better job..."  Mr. Doherty's answer reads: "For 23 years I've been a Democrat, and always will be.  You don't get anything under the GOP.  Democrats have done all right, from Roosevelt up to the present time, and Kennedy will continue the tradition."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Rogers Cleveland wearing zippered jacket and hat, standing on sidewalk in front of RAAB Clothes sign, Wood Street, Downtown; Portrait of William Doherty wearing light colored suit jacket with lapel pin, standing in front of swirled granite wall, Wood Street, Downtown
